meanings.definition: To excite the senses or desires of someone
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies tantalised my taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The colorful advertisement tantalised customers to try the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent3: The magician tantalised the audience by making the rabbit disappear and reappear.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious treasure map tantalised the young explorers with promises of hidden riches.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ocean waves tantalised her sense of adventure, urging her to explore the beach.

meanings.definition: To tease or torment someone with the promise of something unattainable
meanings.sent1: The mischievous siblings tantalised their cat with a laser pointer, making it chase the elusive dot.
meanings.sent2: The con artist tantalised the naive investors with false promises of high returns.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tantalised the hungry crow by holding a piece of cheese just out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert tantalised the weary travelers with visions of an oasis.
meanings.sent5: The unreachable goal tantalised him, driving him to work harder to achieve it.
